As I chatted with the ostlers, I learned about the various trades and professions that were represented in the community, from the blacksmiths and carpenters to the bakers and brewers. I also heard rumors of a nearby market, where one could find all manner of goods and commodities, from fresh produce and meats to handmade crafts and textiles. My curiosity piqued, I decided to investigate further and made my way to the market, which was said to be located just a short walk from the mews. As I wandered through the stalls, I was struck by the vibrant colors and lively atmosphere, and I spent several hours browsing the various offerings and speaking with the vendors. It was a truly immersive experience, and one that gave me a deeper understanding of the local culture and way of life. Eventually, as the sun began to set, I made my way back to the mews, where I was greeted as an old friend by the ostlers, who invited me to join them for a hearty supper and a night of storytelling and music.

Me parecía demasiado bueno para ser verdad, pero decidí investigar un poco más. Así que me dirigí a la dirección indicada en el anuncio y encontré una oficina pequeña y modesta en un edificio antiguo. La recepcionista me recibió con una sonrisa y me hizo pasar a una sala de espera. Después de unos minutos, salió un hombre mayor con gafas y bigote, que se presentó como el señor Duncan. Me explicó que la empresa se dedicaba a la creación de una nueva enciclopedia y que necesitaban a alguien con mis habilidades para copiar textos con precisión y rapidez. Me mostró la oficina donde trabajaríamos y me presentó a mis futuros compañeros de trabajo. Todo parecía normal, pero había algo que no me cuadraba. El señor Duncan parecía nervioso y evasivo cuando le hice preguntas sobre el proyecto. A pesar de mis dudas, decidí aceptar el trabajo, ya que el salario era demasiado tentador para rechazarlo. La noche se estaba volviendo cada vez más oscura y peligrosa, pero Holmes y yo estábamos decididos a desentrañar el enigma detrás del anuncio, sin importarnos el riesgo que conllevaba.

en_first_half: “The man married a woman very much older than himself for her money,” said he, “and he enjoyed the use of the money of the daughter as long as she lived with them. It was a considerable sum, for people in their position, and the loss of it would have made a serious difference. It was worth an effort to preserve it. The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long. Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her stepfather do to prevent it? He takes the obvious course
en_second_half: of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. She became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever stepfather do then? He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl’s short sight, he appears as Mr. Hosmer Angel, and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.”

The stepfather, sensing that he is losing his grip on the situation, becomes increasingly desperate and resorts to underhanded tactics to try and keep the couple apart. But the daughter is not so easily swayed, and she sees through her stepfather's schemes. She realizes that she must take drastic action to secure her own happiness and financial independence. With the help of her lover, she begins to make arrangements to leave her stepfather's household and start a new life, free from his manipulation and control. As the day of their escape approaches, the tension builds, and the stepfather's true nature is revealed in all its ugliness. The daughter and her lover must be careful to avoid his wrath, but they are determined to build a life together, no matter the cost. In the end, they succeed in outwitting the stepfather and securing their freedom, but not before he unleashes a torrent of anger and resentment upon them. The experience leaves them shaken but more in love than ever, and they emerge from the ordeal with a deeper understanding of each other and a stronger commitment to their future together. The stepfather, on the other hand, is left to face the consequences of his own actions, his schemes and manipulations ultimately leading to his own downfall. As the dust settles, the daughter and her lover look to the future, ready to build a life filled with love, laughter, and adventure, free from the toxic influence of the stepfather and his selfish desires.

A veces me pregunto si vale la pena seguir luchando, si el dolor y la lucha diaria valen la pena por los momentos fugaces de alegría y conexión con los que me rodean. Me duele saber que mi condición les causa tanto dolor, que mi muerte es algo que ya están empezando a aceptar, aunque no quieran admitirlo. En estos momentos de oscuridad, me pregunto qué habría sido de mi vida si hubiera tomado decisiones diferentes, si hubiera sido más consciente de mi salud, si hubiera amado y vivido con más intensidad. "I've got it, Watson!" he exclaimed, his voice low and urgent, "the solution to the mystery that has been puzzling us for weeks, and it's been staring us in the face all along." With a swift movement, he rose from his chair and began pacing back and forth across the room, his long strides devouring the distance as he outlined the details of his plan, his words tumbling out in a rapid, excited torrent that left Watson struggling to keep up. As the night wore on, the fire burned low, but the intellectual inferno that had been ignited in Holmes' mind showed no signs of abating, and Watson couldn't help but feel a thrill of anticipation at the prospect of the thrilling adventure that lay ahead.

Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.

en_results_raw: of a street lamp or the faint glow of a distant house. The darkness outside seemed to press in around us, making the interior of the carriage feel claustrophobic and oppressive. I began to feel a sense of unease, as if we were being swallowed up by the night itself. Colonel Stark's silence didn't help, and I found myself wondering what he was thinking, what his intentions were. Was he taking me to some secluded spot to discuss the matter further, or was there something more sinister at play? I tried to push the thoughts aside, telling myself I was being foolish, but they lingered in the back of my mind like a shadow. As we drove on, the jolting and lurching grew worse, and I had to hold on to the seat to prevent myself from being thrown about. The Colonel, on the other hand, seemed entirely at ease, his eyes fixed on some point ahead as if willing us to reach our destination. I began to feel a sense of trepidation, a feeling that we were hurtling towards some unknown fate, and that I was powerless to stop it. The carriage wheels screeched and groaned, the sound echoing through the stillness like a cry of protest. And then, just as suddenly as it had begun, the journey ended. The carriage came to a stop, and the Colonel turned to me with an enigmatic smile. "We're here," he said, his voice low and gravelly. I looked around, trying to take in our surroundings, but the darkness was absolute, and I could see nothing. The Colonel opened the door and stepped out, beckoning me to follow. I hesitated for a moment, unsure of what lay ahead, but something about his manner brooked no argument. I took a deep breath and stepped out into the unknown, the darkness closing around me like a shroud.

es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

"What's all the commotion about, Colonel?" she asked, her voice low and smooth, like honey. The colonel cleared his throat, his eyes darting towards me before returning to the woman. "We've had a bit of an incident," he began, his voice gruff. "This young man here has had a bit of a mishap. I'm afraid he's had a bit of a shock." The woman's eyes snapped back to me, and she took a step closer, her face filled with concern. "Oh, poor thing," she cooed, her voice dripping with sympathy. "Come, let's get you sat down and comfortable. I'll get some tea made, and we'll get to the bottom of this." Tenía el cabello oscuro y largo, y sus ojos brillaban con una luz cálida y acogedora. El coronel se detuvo en seco y la miró con una mezcla de sorpresa y curiosidad, como si no esperara verla allí. La mujer se detuvo frente a nosotros y bajó la lámpara, iluminando el rostro del coronel y el mío. Pude ver la sorpresa en su rostro, y luego una sonrisa se dibujó en sus labios. "¿Quiénes son ustedes?", preguntó con una voz suave y melodiosa. El coronel se aclaró la garganta y se presentó, explicando nuestra situación y cómo habíamos llegado a la casa. La mujer escuchó atentamente, con una expresión de interés y curiosidad. Cuando el coronel terminó de hablar, ella asintió con la cabeza y nos invitó a seguirle. "Vengan", dijo, "les mostraré dónde pueden descansar". Y con eso, nos llevó a través de la casa, hacia un lugar que parecía ser una especie de salón. La habitación estaba llena de muebles antiguos y había un gran fuego ardiendo en la chimenea. La mujer nos indicó que nos sentáramos y se ofreció a traernos algo de beber. El coronel y yo nos sentamos en un sofá, exhaustos, y la mujer se dirigió hacia una puerta que parecía llevar a la cocina. Mientras esperábamos, pude mirar alrededor de la habitación y notar los detalles de la decoración. Había cuadros antiguos en las paredes, y los muebles parecían haber sido restaurados con cuidado. La habitación tenía un ambiente cálido y acogedor, y me sentí agradecido de haber encontrado un lugar seguro para descansar. La mujer regresó con una bandeja que llevaba dos tazas de té y se las ofreció al coronel y a mí. Nos sentamos en silencio durante un rato, bebiendo el té y disfrutando del calor del fuego. Luego, la mujer se sentó en una silla frente a nosotros y comenzó a hablar. "Me llamo Sofía", dijo, "y esta es mi casa. He estado viviendo aquí durante algunos años, después de que mi familia se mudara a la ciudad". El coronel y yo la escuchamos atentamente, interesados en su historia. Sofía nos contó sobre su vida en la casa, y cómo había aprendido a vivir sola y a cuidar de sí misma. Mientras hablaba, pude notar que había algo triste en su voz, algo que no quería compartir con nosotros. Pero a pesar de eso, su sonrisa y su mirada cálida me hicieron sentir que era una persona amable y generosa, y me sentí agradecido de haberla conocido.

en_first_half: “In the first place, I may say that I have met, on the whole, with no actual ill-treatment from Mr. and Mrs. Rucastle.

en_results: However, their behavior towards me has been somewhat peculiar and has left me with an unsettling feeling, as
en_results_raw: However, their behavior towards me has been somewhat peculiar and has left me with an unsettling feeling, as if they are hiding something behind their polite and courteous facade. I have tried to brush it off as mere paranoia, but the sensation persists, and I find myself constantly on edge, waiting for something to happen. The atmosphere in the house is tense, and I can sense that the servants are also walking on eggshells, never knowing when their employers' moods might shift. Despite the luxurious surroundings and the comfortable life they lead, I have begun to feel like a prisoner in this grand estate, with no clear escape route in sight. The only person who seems to be genuinely kind to me is the little girl, but even her affection is tinged with a sadness that I don't fully understand. As the days turn into weeks, I am becoming increasingly desperate to uncover the truth behind the Rucastles' strange behavior and to find a way out of this suffocating environment before it's too late.

en_first_half: “You will find it rather disconnected, I fear, and there may prove to be little relation between the different incidents of which I speak. On the very first day that I was at the Copper Beeches,
en_second_half: Mr. Rucastle took me to a small outhouse which stands near the kitchen door. As we approached it I heard the sharp rattling of a chain, and the sound as of a large animal moving about.
en_results: I began to notice certain peculiarities about the household that struck me as being quite out of the ordinary. The mistress of the house, Mrs. Fowler, seemed to be a woman of strict and
en_results_raw: I began to notice certain peculiarities about the household that struck me as being quite out of the ordinary. The mistress of the house, Mrs. Fowler, seemed to be a woman of strict and unyielding principles, with a stern expression that rarely, if ever, relaxed into a smile. Her daughter, Effie, on the other hand, was a lively and vivacious young girl, with a quick wit and a mischievous glint in her eye that suggested a sharp intelligence and a strong will. As I settled into my new role as governess, I found myself drawn to Effie's warm and affectionate nature, and I soon discovered that she was a kind and gentle soul, eager to please and quick to learn. However, as the days passed, I began to sense that there was something troubling Effie, something that she was hesitant to discuss, and I found myself wondering what secrets the Copper Beeches might hold, and what lay behind the strange and unsettling atmosphere that seemed to pervade the house. Despite my initial reservations, I was determined to uncover the truth, and to help Effie in any way that I could, and so I set out to observe and to listen, to gather as much information as possible, and to piece together the puzzle of the Copper Beeches, one fragment at a time.

es_results_raw: a dar un paseo por los alrededores de la finca, mostrándome los jardines y los establos. Me llamó la atención la gran cantidad de perros que había en la propiedad, todos ellos muy bien cuidados y adiestrados. El señor Rucastle me explicó que era un apasionado de la caza y que los perros eran una parte importante de su vida. Mientras caminábamos, noté que había una serie de edificios anexos a la mansión principal, incluyendo una casita que parecía estar deshabitada. El señor Rucastle me dijo que era la casa del guarda, pero que en ese momento estaba vacía porque el anterior guarda había dejado el puesto hacía poco tiempo. Me pareció extraño que no hubiera mencionado nada sobre el nuevo guarda, pero no quise hacer preguntas para no parecer indiscreto. A medida que seguíamos caminando, el señor Rucastle me habló sobre su familia y su historia, y me di cuenta de que era un hombre muy orgulloso de su herencia y su posición social. Sin embargo, había algo en su forma de hablar que me hizo sentir incómodo, como si estuviera ocultando algo detrás de su sonrisa amable y su comportamiento cortés.
